subject: Back from Montana
event:
Back home again from Missoula, Montana, where I spent the weekend as GOH at Miscon 26.

'twas my first trip to Montana, and I can't say I really saw much of it, but Missoula was a pleasant little city, and the con itself was great.  They drew 1300 people, I'm told, a record for Miscon, and I think all of them had a great time.  I know I did.  Miscon fen party like we did in the old days, and the hotel -- Ruby's, a small indy with local ownership -- was really great.  None of the nonsense with noise complaints and shutting down parties and elevators that has plagued so many cons of late.  In fact, some of the hotel management partied with us.

So a tip of the hat to Justin, Cthulhu Bob, Clay, and the rest of the Miscon Miscreants, and to Tim, Dustan, and Vicky from Ruby's.  You were great.

comments.article: Loved the episode you wrote for the tv seiries
comments.subject: Blackwater

comments.article:
Welcome home George! I hope you've had time to revel in the commendations for Sundays episode!

In the years leading up to the release of ADwD I would frequent the Ice and Fire Update section. I noticed there is still the 'Done' post...any chance you'd put something up there, anything, even a simple word like 'writing'? It's fun to see stuff there. And since I'm asking also maybe a sample chapter for Winds? And start working on your Emmy speech for best drama. Mad Men will be de-throned by Thrones!
comments.subject: Ice and Fire Update

comments.article: There's been a sample chapter from WINDS OF WINTER up on my website for many months now.
comments.subject: Re: Ice and Fire Update

comments.article:
... safely.

Congrats on "Blackwater" - it was the best episode this season in terms of respecting the source material. It also was the best paced of any of the episodes, too. Season 2 has seemed rushed this year. I'm glad that next year, aSoS will be split between Seasons 3 and 4. Admittedly, I was worried that Tyrion hadn't started his chain in earlier episodes, but I'm thrilled that you addressed that omission cleverly - I hardly noticed it was missing. Kudos.

I am a bit worried that Dany's adventure in the House of the Undying might be pared back for time or moved off to Season 3, Episode 20 looks to be very busy. A viewer must have faith.

Again, grats on Episode 19!
comments.subject: Glad you're back ...

comments.article:
Seven blessings on you George! By the Lord of Light you sure are a busy man. I hope you enjoyed the final cut of your collaboration with Neil Marshall- I know the masses did! I wish the ratings had been higher- but Memorial Day Weekend and NBA Finals pretty much explains that away.

I really hope to see you and Neil collaborate again- maybe for RW? That would be a dream come true- although I can't imagine how difficult writing that script would be for you!(simply from an emotional standpoint, just as you've stated about writing the chapter)

Thanks for being you!
Glad you had a good time, George! It was a great pleasure to meet you.

Miscon loved having you, and now you understand why I, like many others, drive 8 hours to attend. Unlike many pros, you know how to party.

I hope to have the chance to enjoy your company again.

Red
(Snidely Whiplash)
comments.subject: Let's do that again!

comments.article: It was great to see you there!  Lots of fun...one of the best Miscons I've experienced in the four years I've been going.

I just wanted to say that I LOVE your books, thank you so much for writing them! I'm "forcing" everyone I know to read A Song Of Ice And Fire, I get them hooked by giving them the first book as a present for their birthday and after that it's like a drug, they *need* to keep reading! :-) I also read some of your short SF stories and it's confirmed, I love your style, stories and characters. I do hope to meet you some day :-). Once again, thank you ^_^.

comments.upictitle: Xray Is As Xray Does: cocktail
comments.article: Welcome back. I am glad to hear that everyone, including the hotel staff, had an excellent time.

comments.upictitle: et in Arcadia egoboo: Chicago (from Adler)
comments.article:
That's . . . 2% of the population of Missoula.
If by "party like we did in the old days" you mean people aren't asleep by 2 a.m., but still talking and partying for hours, maybe I'll go to a Miscon.

comments.upictitle: ☁ come the dawn, we shall see: ❖ (luna) . it was like having friends
comments.article: Glad to hear you had a great time, welcome back! I also want to thank you for the Blackwater episode, by the way .. It's my favorite episode of the second season by far! I especially loved the wildfire & badass battle scenes -- especially the Stannis bits ♥

Glad you had a great time! Recently I finished Dance With Dragons, and am all caught up with the main Ice and fire books...looking forward to the remaining volumes, as well as Dunk and Egg material. The season finale for Game of Thrones is a few days away (love the title for it) as is the soundtrack release. Base don the tracklisting, i have a good diea on how the season will end... I'd written you a letter that you shall receive sometime in June via your publisher.

First off, the episode "Blackwater" blew me away. :). It exceeded my own imagination at the point where they show off the CGI. (the deck vanishing from beneath a certain character's feet gave me the chills and left me on my knees looking for my jaw).
I had some questions around why Stannis was first out the boat and up the ladder, all without helmet, yet I feel I shouldn't ask. Wasn't critisism, but more questions directed toward Stannis from the books and if the series were "cannon" at all. I love the character Stannis in the books almost as much as I love Theon and Jaime, and this episode just made me love him even more.
That being said, you're a cruel man for getting me to invest in a character that's so thinly armoured against the other, more prominent characters (possibly a distant relative).

Anyways, I saw this post, went to Miscon's website and noticed they'd planned a reading. I'm not so much a "niggard" as I'm far away from Montana (I live in Europe) and in the middle of my exams, so I couldn't be there. I was wondering if there is a way that we can hear/read the chapter you've read.

Sorry for bothering you with the question and the lenghty post.
I'm very enthralled by your writing and I thank you for the many, many adventures you've given me.

Edit: One last thing. A few of us in the bowels of internet, down in the dirty lower classes of forums, agreed that if you were ever to play a part in the HBO series, you should be one of the musicians at The Twins. Looking straight in the camera and smiling before playing your part. :)
comments.subject: Reading at Miscon

comments.article: It was great to have you here in Missoula. I wish that you had been able to see more of our great state. Maybe you will come visit us again. Did you get a chance to taste the mead? I hope you liked it. Enjoy your down time at home, and thanks again! My mom loved her signed birthday book!
comments.subject: Thanks for visiting MT!

comments.article: Wish I'd known you were going to be there. I would have planned a trip up to MT to see my family and you!

This was also my first year attending Miscon. Other than a few capacity issues, my expectations were greatly surpassed. In part because Cthulu Bob and his crew know how to get things done. Another big part of it was thanks to you. The Winds of Winter Reading and The Blackwater Viewing were my favorite parts of the convention.

Thanks for the awesome personalization. I have had your 'They can keep their heaven. When I die, I'd sooner go to Middle Earth' quote on my Facebook page for years now.
comments.subject: First Miscon

comments.article: Right back at you, George! Even though putting on a convention is always a lot of work, it was great to hang out with you when I had the chance. We ended up with 1420 total attendees at MisCon, largely due to you being there. Thanks!
comments.subject: MisCon 26

comments.article: I just have to put my vote in, too! The "Blackwater" episode blew me away, and my family members who haven't read the books and sat around me watching were just enthralled. Peter Dinklage outdid himself once again, however, I think that Lena Headey topped everyone. Anyone agree?
comments.subject: Blackwater

comments.article: Lena was definitely killing it.  I love her.  And yes, probably my favorite episode yet.  The Hound is awesome. :)
comments.subject: Re: Blackwater

comments.article: Nice to know that Montana has its fair share of geeks -- in case I end up buying some property in those parts. :)

Oh man, so jealous!  My brother-not-in-law-because-there's-no-eq<wbr />ual-marriage sent us a picture of his copy of Dance with Dragons that you signed.  He also sent us a picture of him sitting on the Iron Throne, but that's bullshit, because there's no way he could rule the Seven Kingdoms.
I hope you can make it to the great state of Wisconsin sometime George!
comments.subject: Back from Montana

comments.article:
We've been arguing about it since Sunday-- and you have the final word on this. Half of us think Matthos screamed "Drums!" and the other half believes he was shouting "To arms!" Closed captioning on our TV can sometimes be incorrect, so we can't trust it.
Who's right on this totally important matter?

Thanks! Great episode!

We had the same problem. Since Davos said something to the affect of "they want music?!" and then says either "Drums" or "To arms" right after, I decided to go with the drums version because of  the music reference. But both work, and in a way both might even mean the same thing when you're storming Kings Landing. If you hear the war drums, time to arm up! Great episode!

comments.upictitle: Lisa: Before someone drops a WHAT on me?
comments.article: It was so nice meeting you at Miscon -- we drove down from Canada, about an 8-10 hour drive just because you were there. The reading and the viewing of Blackwater were awesome, thanks so much!

My family and I have been reading all the Game of Thrones books and they have been enjoyable. I just finished A Dance with Dragons, great work, can't wait for another! But please don't kill of Jon Snow!!!!! Thanks for the great reading, on to the show now!
comments.subject: A Dance with Dragons

comments.article:
Hey George! Congratulations on your marvelous work!

I've read all five books but I just can't get enough, so I'm looking for the Dunk and Egg tales. You spoke about a collection that would be published someday and would contain the first four novellas, but the only informations I found about that are a year old! Can you tell us anything about this?
Thanks!
comments.subject: Dunk and Egg
